column4: so I am trying to install a .deb file but it's complaining about a  dependency that cannot be satisfied libqt4-opengl ( >=4.5.1) From what I can tell that's only on Karmic but I am still on Jaunty, anyway to get that libqt4-opengl 4.51?
Lint in /etc/apt/sources.list? which one? restricted, universe multiverse?
won't that conflict with my current jaunty source?
it won't unless you'll try to upgrade
aha! Iam likely going to at some point... so when I need to upgrade just comment that out?
So I just added main and then sudo apt-get update and looked into synaptic and I don't see 4.5.1 :s
did you reload package lists? you should see many updated packages
what do you mean by reload?
press Reload button in Synaptic, for example
aha! I hadn't hit the save button on sources.list :p
do you see upgradable package list? is that library there?
no it's not... nothing is upgradable either ..
strange, it worked for me some time ago... do you see a new repository in 'Software Sources'?
argh, stupid me ... I added ppa.launchpad instead of the actual karmic main. Thanks!
